str2: One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular

str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To recline, especially at a dinner-table. From ana and keimai; to recline.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Apparently a primary word; the bosom; by analogy, a bay.
